Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not worth the price – and watch carefully cancellation clauses before booking!”
Reviews.Author: flup
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this little boutique hotel. It is located rue Mermoz, nearby the Champs Elysees, and although on the opposite side of the Rond-Point from avenue Montaigne, this street is nowhere near to offer the same hype, but is relatively quiet. Rooms, while not very large, are spacious enough, clean, relatively well decorated and well equipped with flat screen TV, iPod docking station etc. Bathrooms are minuscule, but also clean and there is on the other hand a separate toilet which is much appreciated. Reception staff are always welcoming and friendly. My main complaint about this hotel concerns their pricing policy and commercial practices. While I had previously staid here last year for slightly over 200 Euros a night, they charged me this time 285 Euros for an equivalent room… and this was supposedly a “special offer” with no cancellation opportunity. As the room was booked by my secretary I paid no attention to this, until I realized that my credit card had already been debited by the amount of my reservation 2 days after the booking was done – that is, one month prior to my stay! Management may certainly argue I should have read the fine print, but it remains that (i) debiting the CC in advance is an unusual practice and I definitely didn’t like it and (ii) 285 Euros for a so-called “special offer” in this hotel is way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish rooms, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TonyMCardiff
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. It fulfilled all our expectations. Our room was tastefully decorated, the beds were comfortable (even the sofabed that our children slept on in the living-room section of the 2-room suite). The service was unobtrusive, friendly, and consistently helpful. The breakfast was of a good quality. The location is good, with good access to metro stations, shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Gladys C
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service and close to amenities like taxi stand , restaurants ( various cuisine), bakeries and grocery store. Chose this as was traveling with teenage kids and could have sofa bed in junior suite that can be pulled out as extra bed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: SDGC4
Reviews.Content: First, my husband and I do a lot of traveling and I often feel inclined to leave a rating on TripAdvisor, but usually don't take the time to do so. After just spending 2 nights at the Elysees Mermoz (we left today!), I just had to share my GREAT experience. Selecting a hotel in Paris is not easy, there are so many choices and we took a chance on booking at a small boutique type hotel, like this. We are usual ones that stick to major chains, Hyatt, Four Seasons, etc... you get the point. I can't say how wonderful the experience was. The hotel is small, smaller rooms, but a very wonderful and comfortable stay. They have wonderful amenities in the bathroom (ladies, you know what I mean) and the rooms are modern and SO CLEAN. I'm quite picky with cleanliness and can find something wrong with any room, this room was spotless. They offer a continental breakfast that they will deliver to your room which is delicious and they don't skimp on the bakery basket! I tried room service dinner and didn't notice any hot dishes, which some people might not like, but other than that, this was by far one of the best experiences I've had with a hotel. Also to mention, there is a super friend girl that works at the front desk (not sure her name, she had beautiful long dark hair) who is so friendly and willing to help at any time. For the price paid, the service was beyond exceptional. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. It's also super close to Champs Elysees! You can't go wrong with that!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a scam! Do not stay or book here - you are warned!”
Reviews.Author: Dr J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a scam - my reservation was cancelled well in advance of their "48hour" window, and they billed me for my stay regardless. I have documentation from their computer system that I voided the stay prior to my check in date (several days prior), and was billed anyway. Furthermore, this is not some simple accounting error, as I called and disputed with the hotel, which they were unwilling to fix it and told me to take it up with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Prince_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during 2010/2011 new years eve and it was our first time travelling to Paris. It was an excellent hotel in every way. 1. Located close to Champs Elysees 2. Metro in walking distance 3. Extremely clean, quite, and everything about hotel was newly renovated 4. Walking distance to alot of major sites 5. Value for money 6. Stored our bags & have a shared computer in common area with internet which is free We were skeptical due to the horror stories you hear about Paris, however the hotel exceeded expectations. We booked a junior suite, it is very large. Bathroom is new and modern, with a seperate bath and shower. Had a living area with its own tv along with the room having its own tv. We always want to ensure we have a nice clean bathroom and this hotel met our expectations in this area. The staff were curteous and always willing to help. They even gave us free stamps and showed us the nearest post box for post cards we were sending back home. They even helped us book cabs without an extra charge and calling our day tour companies and speaking in french to confirm meetinig points etc. Booked through hotels.com and recieved a rate far cheaper then what the hotel was offering at that time, so shop around. I would def come back and stay here in the future!! Only con would be that you have to take your own luggage up. they dont assist you with this, so be mindful of this. However im sure they would assist if you need the help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near Champ Elysee”
Reviews.Author: Piyush47
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nites - checked in late at night - smooth check in no problems - great hotel comfortable room - great toiletries in Bathroom. The location is great very close to Metro Station - easy to get to Gare Du Nord / Airport and lots of nice bars and restaurants nearby. Great Area with lots of Contemporary Art Gallery - really enjoyed my two days stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mac082
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel nice rooms helpful staff very central location. Good restaurants and bars within walking distance.We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Betaph
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel and we loved it!! The room was clean and beautiful. The staff was helpful. And the location was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located from all the best attractions...Arch de Triumph, Eiffel tower..etc. Walking distance to large number of sites, restaurants and shopping. Rooms were quaint and immaculate and tastefully decorated. Staff were courteous and efficient. We would highly recommend this boutique hotel to friends and family. Would return in a heartbeat....

Reviews.Title: “Small, Modern & Worth a Booking”
Reviews.Author: PerthJuney
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel recently and were nicely surprised. Although I should expect most hotels in Paris to be minute, it surprised me that this one was because it was quite modern. Although I dont think money was wasted in this refurbishment, it is done with taste. Pleasant to stay in, most of the staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel was clean and well cared for, but most of all, the continental breakfast was fresh, tasty and value for money. the location of the hotel was easy, close to Champs Élysées and to the Metro train station,which will take you anywhere. All in all, a hotel that we would come back to.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjxuhk
Reviews.Content: travel to paris as a couple, the location is fatansitc for shopping! most of the designer's shops are just a stone's throw away. room size is not excatly small for paris standard. the breakfast at basement is a good deal! rooms were apparently newly renovated, hope they can keep up the quality and if so, we will definitely revisit the hotel next time. =)

Reviews.Title: “Single woman - first time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: joancn2009
Reviews.Content: I arrived alone at the hotel at 12:30PM from California, USA. on Saturday Sept. 3rd, 2011. My traveling companion had to cancel a few days before the trip due to illness. I was welcomed by a very nice young lady who spoke perfect English and shown to my room. immediately. It was beautiful, clean, nice large bathtub for soaking, everything worked and a window that opened. Bed was hard enough for my liking but not too hard. All and all I was very pleased as we had picked the hotel from online.. The hotel staff are all very helpful and spoke some English. The hotel is on a short street about 5 min. walk from Champs Elysees with Louvre and other museums left on Champ Elysees'. with shopping to the right.. The street is very quiet at night and there are numerous restaurants on the street within a short walk. I particularly like the Cafe up the street where the staff is friendly, and the food is good. The breakfast at the hotel was more than plentiful, great coffee, meats, cheeses, fruits and choices of breads along with croissants of course. I was welcomed everywhere I went along there. There is an embassy up the street so there is 24 hour police or guards there also. I was there 3 nights and would go back in a heartbeat. Love, Love Love Paris and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, service”
Reviews.Author: anonymx
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend with kids in Paris; location was fabulous not only because of Champs Elysee close by but also because of the number of restaurants round the corner. Room was very good (suite), service was very good as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice, small, stylish, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_zAustria
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, very close to the main sites and to Champs Elysee. The rooms are very clean, stylish and modern with a cosy bed and modern technical equipment (flat screen, plug in for i-pod) the price is absolutely OK for what you get we even got free wi-fi additionally rooms are not really big but absolutely OK if you are there for business traveling or as a couple for a sight seeing trip

Reviews.Title: “Great location for most of the sites of Paris”
Reviews.Author: AusTravel2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (room 101) for 6 nights. The hotel is a boutique hotel, located a couple of locks from the main designer shoping strip, 2 small blocks from the Champs Elysees, half a dozen blocks from the Arc De Triomphe, 10mins from the Eiffel Tower and a similar disctance from the Louvre. The hotel looks like its been recently refurbished. We stayed in a one Bedroom Suite, a little small, but it had 2 rooms, a small but very nice bathroom and a long workdesk. The location was very quiet by night. Wireless Internet was available for $5 a day. The Street is near Emabassy's, so it reassuring that there were plenty of police about. On the downside, There was no Iron/Board in the room, there was one in the hallway. Buy a Paris Pass to skip the lines at the main attractions (its about $50 euro for a 4 day pass, one day and 2 day passes are also avialable - You can buy this one line, its posted to your home. Our in room safe did not work, we did ask for it to be fixed, but it did not get done the week we stayed. There are plenty of restaurants and cafe's nearby, do try DERET, MARKET, TONG YEN. A safe, centrally located boutique hotel that would suite a family, couple or independent traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and warmly recomended”
Reviews.Author: pvc73
Reviews.Content: I've arranged the accomodation for a group of 4 persons for a period of 5-10 days each. Since the first contact via e-mail the personnel was kind, professional and responsive. The hotel has 25 rooms and has all you need in terms of services. The room was clean, modern and well furnished and big enough for a confortable stay. The location is 2 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees, in a secondary road and close to a forein embassy. This gives to the hotel almost the perfect location, far from the noise of the crowd but really close to the sparkling fashinating famous avanue with all the bars, brasseries, restaurants and almost everything you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT VERY MUCH!”
Reviews.Author: Tatia065
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Friendly and helpful staff. Great location.Enjoyed the breakfast and very cozy room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eventi333
Reviews.Content: Central location, nice suite, good value for money. Patissier nearby C-E has lovely breakfast/lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Amazeu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night break with friends. The hotel is in an excellent location on a quiet street about 5 minutes from the Champs Elysee and really good for exploring Paris. Our room was quite small but very clean, in excellent condition and well equipped with flat screen TV, Radio, IPod docking station and mini bar. Only slight drawback with the room was that it was rather dark with only a small window onto an internal courtyard. Breakfast was served in the basement - again very well set up and a nice feel about it. Only problem was on each morning there was only one person running the breakfast and she couldn't keep up with clearing tables and replenishing the buffet. All in all very good compared to where we have stayed previously in Paris and would certainly recommend and go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,comfortable, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Retiredactive
Reviews.Content: This is a small recently updated, nicely furnished hotel in a great location surrounded by art galleries and three blocks from the Metro. The room has a nice contemporary feel with a very comfortable bed, good lighting, separate toilet room away from the bedroom, and an utterly silent fridge. With an excellent buffet breakfast included in a special pre-paid promotion, we left feeling that this is truly the best value hotel in Paris. Our experience with reception staff (all of whom spoke English) was always pleasant from arranging for internet connection, calling restaurants or taxis.

Reviews.Title: “trully an luxury”
Reviews.Author: balola09
Reviews.Content: great location, good size, clean and modern... that summed up elysees mermoz. The hotel located just a 2 min walk from st honore... and its pretty close to champ elysee and rue montainge, So if u visit paris for shopping.. this hotel is the best based camp. i love the fact that i got ipod dock and the bath room fot rainforest shower... the only thing that i dont like about the hotel is the lift.. i think the lift is pretty small for shopper like us.. our suitcase barely fit together with us.. also the fact that they dont hv porter like the regular hotel...that can help carry stuff... other than that everything is perfect. higlyl reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Hôtel Elysées Mermoz”
Reviews.Author: UmmSaeed
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very near to Champs Elysees. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is nice. The bed is very comfortable. The room is very clean. The hotel little bit small. The parking infront of the hotel is allowed for 5 minutes only for loading/ unloading the luggage and the nearest public park is 10 minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice junior suites”
Reviews.Author: Jaarman
Reviews.Content: Located few steps from Champs Elysees. Junior suite was very nice and spaceful. Clean and newly renovated. We did not had breakfast, but only few steps away is very nice coffee and many restaurants nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: RunninAllOver
Reviews.Content: We were really torn on this hotel. The location is central to all the main attractions in Paris which you can easily walk to. The rooms are on the small side as noted by other reviwers however the bed is very comfortable and we enjoyed terrific sleeps. Unfortunately the Hotel did not honor the price they quoted us, so for that reason we cannot recommend this hotel. Integrity still means something to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel newly remodeled”
Reviews.Author: barb623
Reviews.Content: Elysees Mermoz Hotel is a great hotel on a quieter street just minutes from the Champs Elysees. It has been newly remodeled. We stayed in a deluxe room which was huge, had A/C, and completely soundproof. Best bed we slept in during our 12 day trip to France. Extremely clean, seemed much more than a 3 star hotel. The stafff was very accommodating. Convenient to a Metro stop and taxis but we did walk many places: back from Notre Dame one night and Eiffel Tower another. Our daughter had been studying in France and was leaving Paris to meet us in Normandy before we all returned to Paris. They stored her luggage for 5 days so she didn't have to tote all of her suitcases with her on the train. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in or around the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: 4morg
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for the first time with our children ages, 2 and 9. We were a bit concerned about how they would do in the city and how the Parisians would deal with a moody 2 year old. All anxiety was unfounded. The hotel was perfect. One large living room with a double sofa bed and a separate bedroom with king size bed. New flat screen tv's with satellite in each room gave mom and dad a chance to decompress. A huge bathroom with separate tub and shower. All modern and comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of all attractions and the metro is at the end of it's very quiet street. Staff was great! We didn't eat at the hotel but there is a great boulangerie on the same street and a great corner cafe before you reach the Champs Elysees. Kids were happy to eat pasta and crepes that were available everywhere. We recommend trying to stay away from tourist attractions for eating. The closer you get to them the more expensive and worse the food is. Kids loved the metro and just chasing pigeons! No need to fear. Take them with you!

Reviews.Title: “I left after 15 minutes”
Reviews.Author: PecositaPri
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based off of reviews I had read and a deal on the price. When I went to check-in, I was given the key to room 100 and told that the room was right next to the entrance. You literally pass the room to get from the entrance of the hotel to the reception area. My first concern as a solo, female traveler was about safety. Yes, the hotel is in a big area, but Paris is like any metropolitan city in the world and crime happens. I felt uncomfortable being in a room that was pretty much on top of the street and so easily accessible by anyone who walked in to the hotel. I was also concerned about the noise as I had a 7:30am flight to catch the following morning. I asked the receptionist if there were any other rooms available due to the noise concern and she said that they were fully booked, yet assured me that it was a "very, very quiet room." This was a blatant lie. I went to take a nap before a dinner party. Within 5 minutes, someone came into the hotel. From the bed I could hear the glass doors sliding to open in close. I could also hear every word of the conversation that transpired between the receptionist and the other hotel guest. I went out of the room once their conversation had ended and requested to speak to the manager. I was then informed that the manager was not there and that the receptionist was the only person available. I asked again if there was anybody else with whom I could speak about the issue. The receptionist then told me that they didn't even have any housekeeping staff (Paris in August...). But seriously, no staff when your hotel is fully booked? I told the receptionist I was leaving and to cancel the reservation. She at least recommended another hotel to me (although I didn't find it so I'm not so sure about that...). I happened to be wandering for about 5 minutes before stumbling upon the newly re-opened Beaucamp hotel and had a fantastic experience for the same price. It's a shame because the Elysees Mermoz hotel rooms and enormous bathrooms are beautifully and tastefully done in a modern style. However, the security and noise issues and lack of help from the staff resulted in the absolute worst hotel experience that I have ever had in my life.

Reviews.Title: “not free internet access in the room - 5 euro a day for internet fee”
Reviews.Author: travel293916
Reviews.Content: it said free internet access but it is not unless you pay 5 euro a day if you want to use wi-fi internet in the room. Other things are o.k. clean, closed to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Paris for a family of 4!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflowergirl01
Reviews.Content: I spent ages trying to find a hotel in a good location in Paris that would take 2 adults and 2 children in the same room (and one that had good tripadvisor reviews too!) This hotel was perfect for us. It is well located in a quiet street just off the Champs Elysees - there was no view as such from the rooms BUT it meant a good nights sleep without any traffic noise! The room layout was good and amazingly spacious for Paris (we had a junior suite). Very comfortable big bed, big sofa bed for the children, modern bathroom with toiletries from l'occitane, fluffy towels, good air conditioning, 2 televisions (with BBC and C Beebies!). There was a good room service menu but we didn't use it so don't know what the food was like (I didn't see a restaurant so maybe its ordered from one of the restaurants in the street?). Breakfast was simple but good - friendly lady helped with boiling eggs etc! In fact everyone who worked at the hotel was friendly! There are several restaurants in the street that looked nice - AVOID the resaturant pasta pa pa (or pizza pa pa?) which is at the end of the street on the other side of the road to the hotel - it is one of a chain of pasta and pizza restaurants in Paris - it was very unfriendly and the food was not good! The other Italian (Pasta Basta?) on the same side of the road as the hotel was great for a quick lunch - its tiny and you can either eat in or take away. We paid 250 euros for a midweek night and 216 euro for the friday night - this included breakfast for all of us - it was a special offer only bookable through the website. If we are ever back in Paris then we'll be coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rania201088
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ELYSEES MERMOZ three times the last two years. Each time was better that the previous one. Very friendly staff (they prepared milk for my child at 12 midnight)! Perfect location-just 2 minutes away from Champs Elysee. I felt very secure. Thank you for the hospitality

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Diane05
Reviews.Content: The level of comfort and cleanliness at the Elysees Memoz Hotel is far higher than you'd normally expect of a 3 star hotel. The bed is so comfortable, there's a generous replenishment of luxury toiletries and the the hotel has recently been refurbished so it all looks brand new. Breakfast can be served in your room at no extra cost. All the staff we came across were friendly and helpful. The location is quiet, secure and very convenient for the metro and bus. If you're coming by Eurostar, the no42 bus starts at the Gare du Nord and drops off at the Rond-Point des Champs Elysees, only a few minutes walk from the hotel. A wonderful little hotel which will definetly be our hotel of choice for future trips to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the centre of Paris action. Not overpriced, but over value!”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great little find and as a 4 star hotelier of 20 years, I have seen a few! It had everything the website laid out and the rooms and friendliness from the lady managing the breakfast room in the moring was first class! If you wan to be just off the Champs Elise and close to the Metro to get about town, then this is the place to rest your head at a sensible price! The only thing I could possibly point out would be the maintenance man using his hammer at 8.20am on Saturday morning, nearly but not quite woke me up (but only because I had woken up 5 mins earlier)!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jrh69
Reviews.Content: I would highly suggest and recommend to ppl this hotel, being at the bottom of Champ Elysee this is ideal for the shopping person and within 5 mins from a Metro you can get anywhere on the excelent Metro. The hotel itself is nice decorated, friendly staff. The room is a bit small but you get a new, clean and hi tech room. Each day you get l'occitane toiletries and not some cheap and nasty stuff. Highly recommended to anyone.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location for a solo traveler..”
Reviews.Author: prilna77
Reviews.Content: This hotel belongs to the chain of Design hotels. My room was very small, but smartly planned, had beautiful interior, perfectly clean bathroom and a separate toilet room, well air-conditioned and quiet. Beds were comfortable with clean sheets. Stayed there for 2 nights and didn't care for the view, and there was non (windows opened into an interior yard). Perfect for a short or long stay. Great location: near Champs L'Elysees, Arc de Triumph, 15-20 mins walk to Louvre and Jardin de Tuilrie, 20-30 mins walk to La Tour Eiffel. Lots of restaurants for locals around if you enjoy mingling with the local crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel well located close to the Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerOslo
Reviews.Content: Elysees Mermoz Hotel is a great place to stay for short or long stays. Well located in a quiet and safe area close to Champs Elysees it offers a nice range of good restaurants within short walking distance. The staff is always very helpful and the rooms are vey nice.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt be better!”
Reviews.Author: SecondSoprano
Reviews.Content: Just what we wanted for a long weekend stay in Paris - good location; very clean room, nicely decorated and certainly large enough for the amount of time we were going to stay in it! Fresh towels every day and a nice flat screen tv in the room too and the breakfasts were as substantial as you wanted them to be with self selection from the buffet. The location meant it was easy to get to everything and the hotel is between two metro stations - so heading out to any area of Paris is no problem. Staff efficient and very pleasant and no trouble to leave our bags there for most of the day after we had checked out as our Eurostar booking wasnt until 6pm. Certainly would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good centrally based place to stay - sufficient 'frills' to make it a cut above the average for a 3 star and small enough to feel that the staff actually cared enough to want to make your stay a pleasant one. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien”
Reviews.Author: 1Spyder
Reviews.Content: Two couples spent a total of 10 room nights on two different occassions with in 10 days. April 2008. Patricia (day staff) and Stefan (night staff) were exceptionally accommodating with directions, info and reservations. The quiet street feels comfortable. Acceptable restaurants are close but I prefer the other Bank for dining. The Iraeli Embassy is nearby with 24 hr guards. If you are Metro savvy, Paris is within easy reach. We never ate at the Hotel with so many Patisseries near. The Champs is 5 minutes by foot. The Metro is equally close. This Hotel is a very good value with reasonably sized rooms, nice bathrooms. Our room on the second part of the stay was a little more updated than the first. You will not lose with this Hotel. TW Arlington, TN

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Biz or Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: donjamon
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for either business or pleasure. Walking distance to the most famous tourist attractions in the centre of Paris. Choice of several metro stations to take you further along if required. Only a couple hundred metres away from the bustling Champs Elysees but its on a quite street, nice for those who like to sleep in a tranquil environment. The hotel rooms are small by American standards (although pretty normal size for downtown Paris). They are super clean and everything is pretty much in new condition. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and all speak perfect english. I've stayed at this hotel many times for both business and pleasure and will continue to do so. Overall a very high 3 star rating from my perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: john_rp_06
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at Elysees Mermoz. Great Location, very close to Champs Elysee and walking distance to Tour Eiffel. Policemen were around the hotel, so we felt very safe. Staff was very friendly, as they prepared for us milk at 10 o'clock every night. We will stay there next time in Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Elysees Mermoz Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 30 Rue Jean Mermoz | 08 Arr., 75008 Paris, France
